intro: Pleuranthodium hellwigii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It typically grows in rocky or forested areas and thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
